intro: Cyrtandra zippelii, commonly known as the Zippel's coralplant, is a member of the Campanulaceae family and is native to Hawaii. It is a herbaceous perennial plant characterized by its clustered, tubular flowers that are typically blue or purple in color. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in forest understories on the islands of Hawaii. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
